meanings.definition: To freeze-dry (a substance) by removing the water content.
meanings.sent1: The scientist lyophilizes the strawberries to preserve them for a long time.
meanings.sent2: The company lyophilizes fruits to make them last longer on the shelves.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally lyophilizes the soup, turning it into a crunchy mess.
meanings.sent4: The desert sun lyophilizes the mud, leaving behind a cracked surface.
meanings.sent5: The freeze-drying process lyophilizes the flowers, maintaining their shape and color.

meanings.sent1: She carefully lyophilizes the medication to extend its shelf life.
meanings.sent2: The lab technician lyophilizes the samples before conducting the experiments.
meanings.sent3: The magician lyophilizes the water, turning it into a magical powder.
meanings.sent4: Time seems to lyophilize memories, preserving them in our minds forever.
meanings.sent5: The artist lyophilizes the paint to create unique textures in the artwork.
